---
title: Markdown Syntax
Categories: [Others]
Tags: [Markdown]
---

## Markdown Syntax

### 1. Heading
\# : Heading level 1  
\##: Heading level 2  
\###: Heading level 3  
...

### 2. Bold
\*\*text\*\*  
**text**  

### 3. Italic
\*text\*  
*text*

### 4. Blockquotes
\>blockquote  
\>>blockquote  
>blockquote
>>blockquote

### 5. Lists
-  Ordered List
	1\. 2\. 3\. 4\. ... 
-  Unordered List
	\- or \* or \+
	Don't mix and match delimiters in the same list

### 6. Code
- \`code\`
	`code`
	
- \`\`code\`\`
	``code``
	
- \`\`\`c (or other code types)
	#include <stdio.h>
\`\`\`
	```c 
	#include <stdio.h>
	```

- \`\`code \`backtick\` code \`\`
``code `backtick` code``


### 7.  Horizontal Line
* \-\-\- : Horizontal line
---
* Without blank lines, this would be heading

### 8. Links

- With Title
	[naver]\(https://www.naver.com\)
	[naver](https://www.naver.com)

- Without Title
	\<https://www.naver.com\>
	<https://www.naver.com>
- Reference-style
	I'm from \[South Korea\]\[label\]

	\[label\]: \<link\> 
	* Don't miss return between document and label link.
	
	I'm from [South Korea][1].
	
	[1]: <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea>

### 9. Images 
* \!\[alt-text]\(path-or-URL-to-image-asset "optional-title")

![lion](data:image/jpeg;base64, "lion")
